thread.title: There's A Prosecco-Flavored Edible Nail Polish Because Why Not
thread.title_full: There's A Prosecco-Flavored Edible Nail Polish Because Why Not

author: Daniela Cadena
title: There's A Prosecco-Flavored Edible Nail Polish Because Why Not
text:
View this image ›
giphy.com ID: 10743969 2. Now, thanks to Groupon UK , you can add nail polish to that list. Video available at: https://youtube.com/watch?v=BHwuMwjNkew . youtube.com ID: 10743661 3. Groupon UK is celebrating Mother’s Day by creating what they claim to be prosecco-flavored, zero-calorie, lickable nail polish. View this image ›
youtube.com It’s made with real prosecco and according to the website, it “smells and tastes just like the real thing.”
ID: 10743654 4. The promotional video is pretty standard, but shit gets weird when the model suddenly licks the ~boozy~ polish. You know, because up until now, eating nail polish was not really a thing. View this image ›
youtube.com The ingredients? “Alcohol, Shellac E904, Artificial, Prosecco Flavouring, Propylene Glycol, Sodium Saccharin, Prosecco, Colour, R555 Potassium Aluminium Silicate, E171 Titanium Dioxide, E172 Iron Oxide.”
YUM!
ID: 10743656 5. If this piques your interest, you’re in luck. You can win a free bottle of “Prosecco Polish” by entering Groupon’s sweepstakes , but there’s a catch: It’s only open for users with UK addresses. View this image ›
youtube.com ID: 10743652 So, would you give this nail polish a lick? groupon.co.uk This is so fucking stupid. It makes no sense, but I’m dying to try it. Why is Groupon making nail polish?
